Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and prepare a 10-inch tube pan by greasing and flouring it.
In a large bowl, beat together the butter and sugar until creamy. Mix in egg yolks and continue beating for 10 minutes.
Incorporate the flour gradually, alternating with milk, until the mixture is well combined. Add baking powder and mix.
Fold beaten egg whites into the batter.
Set aside a quarter of the batter and pour the remaining batter into a greased and floured tube pan.
Combine cocoa with the reserved 1/4 of the batter. Pour the mixture into the tube pan and swirl with a fork to create a marbled effect.

Bake in the oven that has been preheated to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 60 to 70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
